subject: RE: [junit] [OT] Testing java with ruby
msgSnippet: Actually, I don t have that much experience with rspec. So far I ve spent about a day experimenting with it and JRuby, going over my typical JUnit / mock
messageBody:
Actually, I don't have that much experience with rspec. So far I've
spent about a day experimenting with it and JRuby, going over my typical
JUnit / mock object use cases. I haven't tried it out on any production
code, only simple classes, so I can't say yet if there's a win in using
it over regular Java unit tests. The biggest downside is probably losing
IDE refactoring support.



It seems like the Exception thing is an actual JRuby problem, but since
it's a pretty extreme edge case I'm sure those guys have more urgent
things to solve. A Java helper class that the rspec mocks can call to
trigger Exceptions may be a workaround, so you don't have to go through
Ruby's "raise" method.

/ Per
